intro: Gyrostachys schaffneri, commonly known as the Schaffner's gyrostachys, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces delicate, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming during the cooler months. It is adapted to survive in dry conditions, with deep roots and a slow growth rate. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
